Play Call Of Duty Mobile, PUBG Mobile On Your PC Using This Official Tencent Emulator

Play Call Of Duty Mobile, PUBG Mobile On Your PC Using This Official Tencent Emulator

Call of Duty Mobile has definitely gained a lot of popularity since it was launched for the public this month.

And while it is fun to play the game on a smartphone, we would love to play this game on a computer with a physical keyboard and mouse. And you can officially do that using an emulator by Tencent.

Getty Images

The emulator is called Gameloop and its available to download for free. What's more, is that you can use this emulator to play games like PUBG Mobile and a bunch of other games that can be browsed in its library.

The emulator helps you not just game with a keyboard and mouse, but it also helps you game in higher resolution up to quad-HD. Also, the game will run smoother on a PC, since it has a better hardware setup than a budget smartphone.

Gameloop

Moreover, playing on a larger screen will give you a better view of the surroundings and help you take down your opponents efficiently.

If you were wondering how would you get this game up and running on the emulator, we've got a step-by-step tutorial to get this done.

Step 1: The first thing you need to do is download the emulator by clicking here.

Step 2: Now install the application on your Windows PC the usual way, just like you install other apps.

Step 3: Once installed, run the app and head to the 'Game Centre' option to the left of the screen

Step 4: Here, search for COD Mobile, or PUBG and simply hit download.

Step 5: Once downloaded, you can run the game from the same 'Game Centre' tab.

COD Mobile

The settings and controls are preset in the emulator, however, you can go ahead and change them if you feel like. To do that, just click the key mapping option on the right side of the window and set them as per your liking.
